alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Granville; Halifax; Nash; Vance; Wake; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 12:13PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Vance, Warren, northwestern Nash, southeastern Granville, northwestern Halifax, northeastern Wake and Franklin Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1212 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Halifax to 12 miles southeast of Warrenton to near Zebulon. Movement was northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Henderson, Louisburg, Warrenton, Halifax, Wake Forest, Zebulon, Franklinton, Norlina and Littleton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Franklin; Granville; Halifax; Nash; Vance; Wake; Warren
